content: I agree with the general concept, but I think what is missing (here and in much of life) is a definition of “happiness” we can all agree on. For me, it’s not the antithesis of loneliness or laziness. History has proved many times in the past that happiness is not always found in those who are experts in pleasures of many kinds. Like any good scientist, we need to construct a hypothesis before we begin experimenting. And how does the research on genetic “happiness set points” mesh with your argument here? Regardless, I do agree that all happiness must begin with an intention to be happy and an awareness of what makes you unhappy.
